analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /

original: bcom ldan 'das w'a ra n'a si na drang srong lhung ba ri dvags kyi nags na dge slong stong tham pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya phal cher dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa /

translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the Deer Park of Vṛji, in the region of Kalandakanivāpa, in the great city of Vārāṇasī, together with a great saṅgha of one thousand monks and five hundred bodhisattvas, almost all of whom were matured in the roots of virtue,

original: las kyi sgrib pa bsal ba sha stag dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa bsal ba sha stag dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
translated: and had cleared away the obscurations of karma.

original: de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' kha gcig 'du 'dzi la dga' bar gnas shing gnyid la dga' ba dang / las la dga' ba dang / smra ba la dga' ba dang / spras pa la dga' ba dang / spags pas spags par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' kha gcig 'du 'dzi la dga' bar gnas shing gnyid la dga' ba dang / las la dga' ba dang / smra ba la dga' ba dang / spras pa la dga' ba dang / spags pas spags par gyur pa dang /
translated: At that time, some bodhisattvas took pleasure in social interactions, took pleasure in sleep, took pleasure in work, took pleasure in talking, took pleasure in adornments, took pleasure in being flattered,

original: rigs pa med pa dang / mi brtson pa dang / le lo can dang / brtson 'grus dman pa dang / sbyor ba btang bar gnas te /
analyzed: rigs pa med pa dang / mi brtson pa dang / le lo can dang / brtson 'grus dman pa dang / sbyor ba btang bar gnas te /
translated: were unreasonable, lazy, and lacking in perseverance, and had given up their practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas byang chub sems dpa' de dag @246b yon tan ma yin pa'i spyod pa 'di lta bu 'di dang ldan par mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas byang chub sems dpa' de dag @246b yon tan ma yin pa'i spyod pa 'di lta bu 'di dang ldan par mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya saw that those bodhisattvas had such unvirtuous conduct.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams ba 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams ba 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya thought this:

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las yongs su nyams kyi /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba las yongs su nyams kyi /
translated: “Alas, these bodhisattvas have fallen away from perfecting the branches of enlightenment.

original: bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag bskul bar bya /
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag bskul bar bya /
translated: I will exhort these bodhisattvas.🔽

original: dran par bya gor ma chag go snyam mo //
analyzed: dran par bya gor ma chag go snyam mo //
translated: I must certainly exhort these bodhisattvas and remind them.🔽”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa phye ma red kyi dus kyi tshe nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa phye ma red kyi dus kyi tshe nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, at dawn, having risen from his meditation,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag ga la ba der song ste phyin nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang lhan cig tu yang dag par mgu bar bya ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag ga la ba der song ste phyin nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang lhan cig tu yang dag par mgu bar bya ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: went to where those bodhisattvas were. Having arrived, he conversed pleasantly with those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and after engaging in various pleasant and delightful conversations, he said to those bodhisattvas,

original: ci rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: ci rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of noble family,

original: khyed dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: khyed dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel ba'am /
translated: have you increased in virtuous qualities

original: yongs su nyams par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par ma gyur tam /
translated: or have you declined?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa byams pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa byams pa /
translated: “Venerable Maitreya,

original: bdag cag ni dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams te 'phel bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: bdag cag ni dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams te 'phel bar ma gyur to //
translated: We have declined in virtue and have not increased.

original: bdag cag de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur snyam pa'i the tshom gyis kyang bdag cag gi sems kun nas dkris shing 'dug go /🔽bdag cag log par ltung ba'i chos can yin nam /
analyzed: bdag cag de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur snyam pa'i the tshom gyis kyang bdag cag gi sems kun nas dkris shing 'dug go / bdag cag log par ltung ba'i chos can yin nam /
translated: We are bound by doubt, wondering whether we will become tathāgatas or not.🔽We are bound by regret, wondering whether we have the qualities of a downfall or not.

original: log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin zhig gu snyam pa'i 'gyod pas kyang @247a *//🔽bdag cag gi sems kun nas dkris shing 'dug ste /
analyzed: log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin zhig gu snyam pa'i 'gyod pas kyang @247a *// bdag cag gi sems kun nas dkris shing 'dug ste /
translated: We are bound by regret, wondering whether we do not have the qualities of a downfall.🔽We have no aspiration for virtue.

original: bdag cag ni dge ba'i chos rnams la yang 'dun pa mi skye'o //🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas /
analyzed: bdag cag ni dge ba'i chos rnams la yang 'dun pa mi skye'o // de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas /
translated: We do not even have the desire for virtuous qualities.”🔽When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said to those bodhisattvas:

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

original: khyed tshur sheg  bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ga la bzhugs pa der 'dong ngo //
analyzed: khyed tshur sheg  bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ga la bzhugs pa der 'dong ngo //
translated: Come, let us go to the bhagavat, the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Shakyamuni.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: That bhagavat is omniscient,

original: thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: he sees everything,

original: ye shes sgrib pa mi mnga' ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ye shes sgrib pa mi mnga' ba dang ldan pa /
translated: he has unobstructed wisdom,

original: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: he is skilled in the conduct of all sentient beings,

original: des khyod kyi spyod pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des khyod kyi spyod pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and he will teach the dharma to you in accordance with your level of conduct.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' drug cu tsam pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' drug cu tsam pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas /
translated: Then, together with the bodhisattva mahasattva Maitreya, the sixty bodhisattvas went to where the bhagavat was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te ngu zhing bcom ldan 'das la yan lag lngas yang dang yang du phyag 'tshal nas gdong la mchi ma zag cing mgo ma bteg go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te ngu zhing bcom ldan 'das la yan lag lngas yang dang yang du phyag 'tshal nas gdong la mchi ma zag cing mgo ma bteg go /
translated: He bowed his head to the feet of the Buddha, wept, and with his five limbs prostrated himself again and again to the Buddha. His face was covered with tears and he could not raise his head.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas kyang /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: also bowed his head to the feet of the Buddha.

original: bcom @247b ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom @247b ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: He circumambulated the Buddha three times and then sat to one side.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Buddha said to those bodhisattvas:

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of good family!

original: khyed ma ngu ma 'gyod par longs /
analyzed: khyed ma ngu ma 'gyod par longs /
translated: Do not cry or regret.

original: khyod nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la mi rtog par dga' zhing mgu la yi rangs pas gzhan la gtse zhing gshe ba byas te /
analyzed: khyod nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la mi rtog par dga' zhing mgu la yi rangs pas gzhan la gtse zhing gshe ba byas te /
translated: Without considering the ripening of your own karma, you have been happy, delighted, and pleased, and have harmed and reviled others.

original: las kyi sgrib pa de lta bu mngon par 'du byas pas da ltar khyed bsgribs shing chod de kun nas bskor cing kun nas dkris nas brtson par mi nus so //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa de lta bu mngon par 'du byas pas da ltar khyed bsgribs shing chod de kun nas bskor cing kun nas dkris nas brtson par mi nus so //
translated: Because of such karmic obscurations, you are now obscured, blocked, surrounded, and bound, and so you are unable to persevere.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' drug cu po de dag gis bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas /🔽pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' drug cu po de dag gis bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas / pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then those sixty bodhisattvas drew down the right shoulder of their upper garments,🔽placed their right knees on the ground,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said to the Blessed One,

original: bdag cag gis gang thos na rang gi sems bzlog par bgyid cing las kyi sgrib pa gzhan yang mngon par 'du mi bgyid par 'gyur ba'i bdag cag gi las kyi sgrib pa; bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag gis gang thos na rang gi sems bzlog par bgyid cing las kyi sgrib pa gzhan yang mngon par 'du mi bgyid par 'gyur ba'i bdag cag gi las kyi sgrib pa; bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, please explain our karmic obscurations so that when we hear about them, we will be able to turn our minds away from them and not create any other karmic obscurations.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa drug cu bo de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa drug cu bo de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When they had made this request, the Bhagavat said to those sixty persons who had become Bodhisattvas,

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: in the past,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel gyi gsung rab la khyed rab tu byung ste 'khod pa na /🔽tshul khrims @248a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel gyi gsung rab la khyed rab tu byung ste 'khod pa na / tshul khrims @248a *//
translated: when you were monks in the teachings of the Tathagata known as Kanakamuni,🔽you were intoxicated with the pride of morality, intoxicated with the pride of learning, and you clung to the ascetic practices and the austerity of few possessions.

original: kyi rgyags pas myos pa dang / thos pa'i rgyags pas myos pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang yo byad bsnyungs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / dge slong chos smra ba gnyis la 'di ltar rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i rgyu dang /
analyzed: kyi rgyags pas myos pa dang / thos pa'i rgyags pas myos pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang yo byad bsnyungs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / dge slong chos smra ba gnyis la 'di ltar rnyed pa dang / bkur sti'i rgyu dang /
translated: You slandered two Dharma teachers, saying, ‘They are motivated by the desire for gain, honor,🔽and fame, and they are attached to the households of their friends and benefactors.’

original: mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim gyi gzhi las phrag dog dang / ser sna dang ldan pas 'khrig pas skur pas skur te /
analyzed: mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim gyi gzhi las phrag dog dang / ser sna dang ldan pas 'khrig pas skur pas skur te /
translated: You were jealous and stingy.

original: chos smra ba'i dge slong de gnyis kyi mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang khyed kyis phye ste /
analyzed: chos smra ba'i dge slong de gnyis kyi mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang khyed kyis phye ste /
translated: You also caused division between the two Dharma teachers and their families and between them and their patrons.

original: the tshom skyed cing ma dad par byas la /
analyzed: the tshom skyed cing ma dad par byas la /
translated: You created doubts and distrust,

original: dge slong chos smra ba de gnyis kyi mi snyan pa mang po dag kyang smras /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba de gnyis kyi mi snyan pa mang po dag kyang smras /
translated: and you spoke ill of the two Dharma teachers.

original: sems can de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang bcad cing dge ba la sgrib par byas te /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang bcad cing dge ba la sgrib par byas te /
translated: You cut off the roots of virtue of those beings and obscured their virtue.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi sgrib pa des khyed lo drug khrir sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skyes so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi sgrib pa des khyed lo drug khrir sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skyes so //
translated: Because of the obscurations of nonvirtuous karma, you were born in the great Avīci Hell for sixty thousand years.

original: lo bzhi khrir ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skyes so //
analyzed: lo bzhi khrir ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skyes so //
translated: For forty thousand years you were born in the great Saṃjiva Hell.

original: lo nyi khrir ni sems can dmyal ba chen po thig nag tu skyes so //
analyzed: lo nyi khrir ni sems can dmyal ba chen po thig nag tu skyes so //
translated: For twenty thousand years you were born in the great Kālasūtra Hell.

original: lo brgyad stong du ni sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha bar skyes so //
analyzed: lo brgyad stong du ni sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha bar skyes so //
translated: For eight thousand years you were born in the great Tapana Hell.

original: khyed de nas shi 'phos nas mi'i lus rnyed pa rnyed nas tshe rabs lnga brgyar mig med de /
analyzed: khyed de nas shi 'phos nas mi'i lus rnyed pa rnyed nas tshe rabs lnga brgyar mig med de /
translated: After you died, you were reborn as a human being, but for five hundred lifetimes you were blind.

original: dmus long du gyur to //
analyzed: dmus long du gyur to //
translated: You were born blind.

original: khyed las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyis bsgribs nas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag thams cad du sems brtul ba dang / brjed @248b ngas par gyur to //
analyzed: khyed las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyis bsgribs nas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag thams cad du sems brtul ba dang / brjed @248b ngas par gyur to //
translated: “You were obscured by that karmic distortion, and wherever you were born, you were always stupid and forgetful.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgrib pas bsgribs shing dbang chung bar grags par gyur to //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgrib pas bsgribs shing dbang chung bar grags par gyur to //
translated: You were obscured by the distortion of unwholesome actions, and you were known to be weak.

original: mi sdug pa'i skyon gyis zil gyis non pa dang / smras pa dang / bshung ba dang / skur pa mang bar yul ngan pa dang / yul 'khor ngan pa dang / ljongs ngan pa dag tu rigs ngan pa dang / dbul po'i rigs dag tu skyes nas /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i skyon gyis zil gyis non pa dang / smras pa dang / bshung ba dang / skur pa mang bar yul ngan pa dang / yul 'khor ngan pa dang / ljongs ngan pa dag tu rigs ngan pa dang / dbul po'i rigs dag tu skyes nas /
translated: You were overcome by the faults of ugliness, and you were often slandered, reviled, and maligned. You were born in bad countries, in bad regions, in bad families, in poor families.

original: rnyed pa chung ba dang / bkur sti chung ba dang / mi bkur ba dang / mi mchod par gyur to //
analyzed: rnyed pa chung ba dang / bkur sti chung ba dang / mi bkur ba dang / mi mchod par gyur to //
translated: You had little wealth, little honor, and no respect or worship.

original: khyed 'di nas shi 'phos nas lnga brgya pa tha ma la dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: khyed 'di nas shi 'phos nas lnga brgya pa tha ma la dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: After you die and transmigrate from here, in the final five hundred years, at the time when the true Dharma is disappearing,

original: yul ngan pa sha stag tu rigs dma' ba dang / dngul po dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul ngan pa sha stag tu rigs dma' ba dang / dngul po dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: you will be born in low castes in bad countries, in the borderlands and so forth.

original: skur pa mang pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba spong ba dang / brtson pa byas kyang bar chad 'byung ba dang / snang ba byung yang phyir nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skur pa mang pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba spong ba dang / brtson pa byas kyang bar chad 'byung ba dang / snang ba byung yang phyir nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will be much maligned, forgetful, abandon your roots of virtue, and even if you make an effort, obstacles will arise, and even if light appears, it will disappear again.

original: khyed lnga brgya pa tha ma la las kyi sgrib pa thams cad zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyed lnga brgya pa tha ma la las kyi sgrib pa thams cad zad par 'gyur te /
translated: But in the final five hundred years, all of your karmic obscurations will be exhausted.

original: zad par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zad par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having exhausted them, you will be born in the buddhafield of the Tathāgata Amitābha, the world system called Sukhāvatī.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med des kyang khyed bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med des kyang khyed bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Tathāgata Amitābha will prophesy that you will attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

translated: The nonhuman spirits will protect them, the gods will increase their splendor, their enemies will not find an opportunity to harm them, and their friends will not be divided.
